SEARCH
Package org.boardgames.crossway.model

Class Game

java.lang.Object
org.boardgames.crossway.model.Game
public class Game extends Object
Core game logic implementation for the Crossway board game. Core game logic implementation for the Crossway board game.

Key features:

  • Turn-based gameplay with automatic player switching.
  • Move validation using configurable pattern rules.
  • Efficient connectivity tracking for win detection.
  • Complete move history with undo/redo capabilities.
  • Game state serialization and export functionality.

The game follows standard Crossway rules where players alternate placing stones on the board, with the goal of creating a connected path of their stones between their designated opposite sides of the board.

See Also:
  • Board
  • PatternChecker

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game(Board board)
      Constructs a new game instance with the specified board.

      Initializes all game components including connectivity tracking, pattern checking rules, and move history. The game starts with the black player by default.

      Parameters:
      board - The game board on which to play. Must not be null.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the board is null.

    • Game

      public Game(BoardSize boardSize)
      Constructs a new game instance with the specified board size.

      This is a convenience constructor that creates a new board with the given dimensions and then initializes the game.

      Parameters:
      boardSize - The dimensions for the new board. Must not be null.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if boardSize is null.

    • Game

      public Game(Board board, History history, Stone currentPlayer, Boolean pieAvailable)
      Constructs a game instance from a serialized JSON string.

      This constructor is used by the Jackson library for deserializing a game state from its JSON representation. It initializes the board, history, and current player based on the provided JSON data. It also rebuilds the transient components like the connectivity tracker and pattern checker.

      Parameters:
      board - The game board from the JSON.
      history - The move history from the JSON.
      currentPlayer - The current player from the JSON.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the board is null.

  • Method Details

    • addBoardChangeListener

      public void addBoardChangeListener(BoardChangeListener listener)
      Registers a listener to be notified when the board state changes.
      Parameters:
      listener - the listener to register

    • canPlace

      public boolean canPlace(Point point, Stone stone)
      Validates whether a stone can be legally placed at the specified position.

      This method delegates comprehensive validation to the PatternChecker, which checks for bounds, cell occupancy, and compliance with all configured pattern rules.

      Parameters:
      point - The board position to validate.
      stone - The stone color to place.
      Returns:
      true if the placement is legal, false otherwise.

    • hasLegalMove

      public boolean hasLegalMove(Stone player)
      Determines whether the given player has at least one legal move available on the current board.

      The method scans every intersection of the board and delegates the validation to canPlace(Point, Stone). The search stops as soon as a legal placement is found.

      Parameters:
      player - the player to check for available moves
      Returns:
      true if the player can place a stone somewhere on the board, false otherwise

    • makeMove

      public void makeMove(Move move)
      Attempts to make a move in the game.

      This is the primary method for game progression. It first validates the move. If the move is legal, it is executed, recorded in the history, and the current player is switched. If the move is invalid, an InvalidMoveException is thrown.

      Parameters:
      move - The move to execute.
      Throws:
      InvalidMoveException - if the move violates any game rule.

    • skipTurn

      public void skipTurn()
      Switches the current player without modifying the board state. This is used when a player must forfeit their turn due to having no legal moves available.

    • undoLastMove

      public void undoLastMove()
      Undoes the most recent move in the game.

      This method reverses the last move by:

      • Retrieving the move from history.
      • Clearing the affected board position.
      • Rolling back the connectivity state to the previous checkpoint.
      • Restoring the previous player (the one who made the undone move).
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if no moves are available to undo.

    • redoLastMove

      public void redoLastMove()
      Redoes the most recently undone move.

      This method re-applies the last undone move by:

      • Retrieving the move from history (which was already moved from future to past).
      • Placing the stone on the board.
      • Updating the connectivity state.
      • Switching to the next player.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if no moves are available to redo.

    • disablePieRule

      public void disablePieRule()
      Disables the pie rule swap option permanently.

    • getMoveHistory

      public List<Move> getMoveHistory()
      Returns a copy of the complete past move history.
      Returns:
      A List of all moves in chronological order.

    • getBoard

      public Board getBoard()
      Returns the current game board.
      Returns:
      The Board instance.

    • getHistory

      public History getHistory()
      Returns the move history.
      Returns:
      The History instance.

    • getCurrentPlayer

      public Stone getCurrentPlayer()
      Returns the stone of the current player.
      Returns:
      The Stone of the player whose turn it is.

    • isPieAvailable

      public boolean isPieAvailable()
      Indicates whether the pie rule swap is currently available.
      Returns:
      true if the swap option is available, false otherwise.

    • hasWon

      public boolean hasWon(Stone stone)
      Determines if the specified stone color has achieved victory.

      A player wins by forming a connected path of their stones that spans between the designated opposite sides of the board. This method delegates to the connectivity system for efficient path detection.

      Parameters:
      stone - The stone color to check for victory.
      Returns:
      true if the specified color has won, false otherwise.

    • toJson

      public String toJson()
      Serializes the current game state into a JSON string.

      This method uses the JsonUtils class to convert the game's essential state (board, history, current player) into a JSON representation. This format is suitable for saving games or transmitting state.

      Returns:
      A JSON string representing the current game state.

    • fromJson

      public static Game fromJson(String json)
      Deserializes a JSON string back into a Game instance.

      This method uses the JsonUtils class to reconstruct a Game object from its JSON representation. It is the counterpart to toJson().

      Parameters:
      json - The JSON string to deserialize.
      Returns:
      A new Game instance with the state from the JSON string.
